top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

I had read something long ago… probably a LPT Reddit post from years ago that said you should buy yourself a cheap set that includes everything. As items wear out replace them with a good quality one as it is a tool you use often. The ones that never need replaced you will continue to get by with till you need a better one.

No, this is not a blanket rule. You need to make the decision on every tool you buy. Sometimes it's a "buy once, cry once" but other times is "harbor freight is good enough". 

For example, I'm probably going to do tile work in the future. I'm going to buy an $80 wet tile saw from harbor freight and use it a handful of times. I don't need fancy. 

Another example, I bought a harbor freight chop saw for $120. It worked great for my needs but it was only a 10" single bevel saw and it was not a slider. I did about 2,000 sqft of laminate flooring with it and it was fine but not super accurate and just OK to use. Now I bought a $350 Dewalt 12" sliding double-bevel compound miter saw.
